title: Roberto Lorenzini
text:
Roberto Lorenzini (born 9 July 1966 in <a href="Milan">Milan</a>) is an Italian professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Association%20football%20manager">coach</a> and a former <a href="Association%20footballer">player</a>, who served as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a>.
Playing career.
A <a href="A.C.%20Milan%20Primavera">Milan youth product</a>, Lorenzini played for 7 seasons (126 games, 1 goal) in the <a href="Serie%20A">Serie A</a> for <a href="A.C.%20Milan">A.C. Milan</a> (10 appearances), <a href="Calcio%20Como">Calcio Como</a>, <a href="A.C.%20Ancona">A.C. Ancona</a>, <a href="Genoa%20C.F.C.">Genoa C.F.C.</a>, <a href="Torino%20Calcio">Torino Calcio</a>, and <a href="Piacenza%20Calcio">Piacenza Calcio</a>, later also playing with <a href="Serie%20B">Serie B</a> side <a href="A.S.%20Lucchese%20Libertas%201905">Lucchese</a>, and <a href="Serie%20C2">Serie C2</a> side <a href="Faenza%20Calcio">Faenza</a>.
Managerial career.
In 2008–09 season he served as an assistant manager to his former Milan teammate <a href="Alessandro%20Costacurta">Alessandro Costacurta</a> at <a href="A.C.%20Mantova">A.C. Mantova</a>, but left together with Costacurta after he resigned due to poor results.
